message_1:
Suppose we have a smooth symplectic manifold $(M,\omega)$ and a Hamiltonian function $H: M \rightarrow \mathbb{R}$ such that all critical points of $H$ are non-degenerate. If $p, q$ are two critical points of $H$ and $M_{p,q}$ denotes the moduli space of (parametrized) J-holomorphic maps from a sphere with two marked points to $M$ with homology class $A \in H_2(M, \mathbb{Z})$ and asymptotic to $p$ and $q$ at the marked points, then show that the dimension of $M_{p,q}$ is given by the formula :

$$\text{dim }M_{p,q}= \mu(p)-\mu(q)+ n-\text{dim }G_p -\text{dim }G_q$$

where $\mu(p)$ is the Maslov index of the loop of Lagrangian subspaces associated to $p$, $n$ is the dimension of $M$, $G_p$ and $G_q$ are the isotropy groups of $p$ and $q$ respectively. Solve for the dimension of $M_{p, q}$ when $\mu(p) = \mu(q) = 1$, $n = 4$, $\text{dim }G_p = \text{dim }G_q = 1$, and $A = PD([C])$ where $C$ is an embedded sphere in $M$ with self-intersection number $1$.
message_2:
Given the values $\mu(p) = \mu(q) = 1$, $n = 4$, $\text{dim }G_p = \text{dim }G_q = 1$, and $A = PD([C])$, we can plug these into the formula for the dimension of $M_{p,q}$:

$$\text{dim }M_{p,q} = \mu(p) - \mu(q) + n - \text{dim }G_p - \text{dim }G_q$$

Substituting the given values, we get:

$$\text{dim }M_{p,q} = 1 - 1 + 4 - 1 - 1$$

Simplifying the expression, we find:

$$\text{dim }M_{p,q} = 2$$

Thus, the dimension of $M_{p, q}$ is $2$ when $\mu(p) = \mu(q) = 1$, $n = 4$, $\text{dim }G_p = \text{dim }G_q = 1$, and $A = PD([C])$ where $C$ is an embedded sphere in $M$ with self-intersection number $1$.
